abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column profiles Christie Rampone, 39-year-old captain of United States women's national soccer team; observes that Rampone's exceptionally long tenure is highlighted by fact that her original tryout invitation was sent by fax; notes that Rampone nearly ignored fax to become a student teacher, a chance that might have changed history of women's soccer.
lead_paragraph: Christie Rampone, the 39-year-old captain of the U.S. women’s national team, was invited to try out in 1997 using the old-fashioned method, and that piece of paper changed her life.

headline.main: How a Fax Helped Rewrite Women’s Soccer in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: How a Fax Helped Rewrite Women’s Soccer in the U.S.

snippet: Christie Rampone, the 39-year-old captain of the U.S. women’s national team, was invited to try out in 1997 using the old-fashioned method, and that piece of paper changed her life.
